metadata.title: CVE-2016-9401 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
popd in bash might allow local users to bypass the restricted shell andcause a use-after-free via a crafted address.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bash - 4.3-7ubuntu1.7
bash-builtins - 4.3-7ubuntu1.7
bash-static - 4.3-7ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bash package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3-7ubuntu1.7').
